intro: Onoseris annua, commonly known as the annual yellowdisk, is an herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by wind. Onoseris annua is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
